title: Essays on Paul Bourget
creator: Mark Twain
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text
description: LibriVox recording of Essays on Paul Bourget, by Mark Twain. Read by John Greenman. Collection of short essays concerning French novelist and critic Paul Bourget. Included: "What Paul Bourget Thinks of Us" and "A Little Note to M. Paul Bourget". (Summary by John Greenman) For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording. For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org. M4B format available
subject: Humor; essay; Samuel Clemens; Paul Bourget; Librivox; audiobook

reviews.reviewbody: Mark Twain and John Greenman. Nothing beats that combination. Essays are GREAT!
